head.supplied: Melbourne, botanic Garden, ¶ 23 June 63. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In acknowledging the receipt of your letter, dated 20 June, I beg that you will kindly convey my sentiments of cordial gratitude to his Worship the ...

div.p: Unit 731, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In acknowledging the receipt of your letter, dated 20 June, I beg that you will kindly convey my sentiments of cordial gratitude to his Worship the Mayor and the other Gentlemen of the City Council for the sentiments which they were pleased to express towards me. I feel, that on the occasion of the auspicious festival I only fulfilled my duty in aiding your arrangements and it is not needful to assure you that you will find me at any future occasion equally ready to respond to any call of sharing in the always so well directed labours of the City Council.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to remain,
